pullrequest.title: Building Editor: Pick colors from the palette and assign on 3D view

content.raw:
It's very difficult to select the color of a wall that is enclosed by other walls and has a floor above it. For example, the walls that are colored white in the image below (this is the second floor of a 3-story building):

![buildingeditorpickcolors.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3700286654-buildingeditorpickcolors.png)

I think this is because the top floor has a transparency of 0, but is still blocking the middle floor. Perhaps using `Visual::SetVisibility` would help? (Yes, our old friend from [#1331](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1331))
content.html:
It's very difficult to select the color of a wall that is enclosed by other walls and has a floor above it. For example, the walls that are colored white in the image below (this is the second floor of a 3-story building):

I think this is because the top floor has a transparency of 0, but is still blocking the middle floor. Perhaps using Visual::SetVisibility would help? (Yes, our old friend from #1331)

content.raw: I wasn't able to reproduce the issue using stairs, but I got a couple of crashes going back into the editor with the mouse moving fast out of the 2D view (as your backtrace suggested). This is hard to reproduce though... I hope commit dc6fddf helped a bit.
content.html: I wasn't able to reproduce the issue using stairs, but I got a couple of crashes going back into the editor with the mouse moving fast out of the 2D view (as your backtrace suggested). This is hard to reproduce though... I hope commit dc6fddf helped a bit.

pullrequest.title: Building Editor: Pick colors from the palette and assign on 3D view

content.raw: I was still getting the bug by making a building, saving it, closing, then opening the building editor and quickly moving the mouse in and out of the 2D view. Proposed fix is in branch hitl_color_mouse_jackie (78fbaad). I believe that if a QGraphicsView tries to access certain information about a QGraphicsItem that is not in its scene, it will segfault.
content.html: I was still getting the bug by making a building, saving it, closing, then opening the building editor and quickly moving the mouse in and out of the 2D view. Proposed fix is in branch hitl_color_mouse_jackie (78fbaad). I believe that if a QGraphicsView tries to access certain information about a QGraphicsItem that is not in its scene, it will segfault.

content.html: I can't really reproduce it, but your fix makes sense, thanks. Merged c46f0b5

pullrequest.title: Building Editor: Pick colors from the palette and assign on 3D view

content.raw:
Agh, I was still getting crashes after exiting the building editor, reentering and mousing over the 2D view. I think there was something weird with `QGraphicsItem::setVisible`. If a QGraphicsItem is invisible, then it does not accept events (see documentation [here](http://qt-project.org/doc/qt-4.8/qgraphicsitem.html#setVisible)). Also, if a QGraphicsItem parent toggles visibility/invisibility, its children also go visible/invisible. I think one of these facts was causing segfaults for me (maybe it was trying to set the visibility of mouseTooltip's children, which are NULL?)

I have a branch where I got rid of all calls to `QGraphicsItem::setVisible` and instead added/removed the mouseTooltip to the scene: hitl_color_mouse_novisibility.
content.html:
Agh, I was still getting crashes after exiting the building editor, reentering and mousing over the 2D view. I think there was something weird with QGraphicsItem::setVisible. If a QGraphicsItem is invisible, then it does not accept events (see documentation here). Also, if a QGraphicsItem parent toggles visibility/invisibility, its children also go visible/invisible. I think one of these facts was causing segfaults for me (maybe it was trying to set the visibility of mouseTooltip's children, which are NULL?)

I have a branch where I got rid of all calls to QGraphicsItem::setVisible and instead added/removed the mouseTooltip to the scene: hitl_color_mouse_novisibility.

pullrequest.title: Building Editor: Pick colors from the palette and assign on 3D view

content.raw: Ah great idea getting rid of `setVisible` altogether. Changes merged, thanks.
content.html: Ah great idea getting rid of setVisible altogether. Changes merged, thanks.

pullrequest.title: Building Editor: Pick colors from the palette and assign on 3D view

content.raw:
Ahh, okay, that's not what I'm seeing.

![wall_progression.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/2783597306-wall_progression.png)

1. An unselected (transparent) blue wall.
2. An selected (opaque) blue wall.
3. An blue wall that is hovered over by an orange color mouse.
4. An opaque orange wall.
5. A transparent orange wall.

This is a pretty subtle difference, but 3 and 4 look different to me. Specifically, 3 looks like a mixture of blue and orange.

You can repeat it with a white wall hovered over with a dark color mouse (blue works pretty well) and you'll see that the middle step looks like a lighter shade of the color.
content.html:
Ahh, okay, that's not what I'm seeing.

  1. An unselected (transparent) blue wall.
  2. An selected (opaque) blue wall.
  3. An blue wall that is hovered over by an orange color mouse.
  4. An opaque orange wall.
  5. A transparent orange wall.

This is a pretty subtle difference, but 3 and 4 look different to me. Specifically, 3 looks like a mixture of blue and orange.

You can repeat it with a white wall hovered over with a dark color mouse (blue works pretty well) and you'll see that the middle step looks like a lighter shade of the color.
